links.*: Tales and Songs of Bimble Bay
The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
'''A Song of Bimble Bay''' is a poem by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in his series [[Tales and Songs of Bimble Bay]], written around [[1928]], first published in ''[[The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien]]''. It is a comic piece about the misadventures of an old man from Bimble Bay, an imaginary English seaside town. There are three manuscripts of the poem, and on the third one a note was written that the poem was to be sung to the tune of [[Wikipedia:The Fox (folk song)|"The Fox Went Out"]], a traditional English folk song also indicated as the tune for [[The Stone Troll]].<ref>{{CP|102}}, pp. 707, 709</ref>
